revised_title: Absorption of Extreme Ultra-Violet Radiation by Inert Gases
tldr: The author conducted experiments to study the absorption of extreme ultra-violet radiation by inert gases like argon, helium, krypton, and neon. They found that the absorption bands for these gases begin around 1036 Angstroms and confirmed the predictions of the dispersion theory. The study also revealed that neon is the most transparent among the inert gases.
